effects: You create a star map (a Tiny object); you can use it as a spellcasting focus for druid spells.
You determine the map’s form by rolling on the Star Map table or choosing one.
While holding the map, you have Guidance and Guiding Bolt prepared, and you can cast Guiding Bolt without expending a spell slot.
If you lose the map, you can perform a 1-hour ceremony during a short or long rest to create a replacement; the old map is destroyed.
limits: You can cast Guiding Bolt this way a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum 1), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

effects: You expend one use of Wild Shape to take a starry form for 10 minutes.
You retain your game statistics while in this form.
You shed bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for 10 more feet.
When you assume the form, choose a constellation; you gain its benefits while the form lasts:
Archer: when you activate the form and as a bonus action on subsequent turns, you can make a ranged spell attack (60 feet) that deals 1d8 + your Wisdom modifier radiant damage on a hit.
Chalice: when you cast a spell using a spell slot that restores hit points, you or another creature within 30 feet regains hit points equal to 1d8 + your Wisdom modifier.
Dragon: when you make an Intelligence or Wisdom check or a Constitution save to maintain Concentration, you can treat a roll of 9 or lower as a 10.
limits: The form ends early if you dismiss it (no action required), have the Incapacitated condition, or use this feature again.

feature_defs.trigger: when you finish a long rest
effects: You consult your star map and roll a die; you gain a reaction based on the result until your next long rest:
Weal (even): when a creature you can see within 30 feet is about to make a d20 test, you can roll 1d6 and add it to the roll.
Woe (odd): when a creature you can see within 30 feet is about to make a d20 test, you can roll 1d6 and subtract it from the roll.
limits: You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier (minimum 1), and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

effects: Dragon grants a fly speed of 20 feet and you can hover.
At the start of each of your turns in Starry Form, you can change the constellation.

feature_defs.trigger: while you are in Starry Form
effects: You are partially incorporeal and have resistance to bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.
